_header: My woeful heart plunged in heaviness
_description: A complaint against his mistress — two stanzas rhyme royal with refrain, ‘Alas vnkyndenesse þus haith my herte slayne’

CULFf16.First Lines:
My whofull herte plonged yn heuynesseComplaynyng in Sorow þus
                    greuyslyStondyng alone now nercylesAll yn discomforte full
                    petusly…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…yn will and þowte and neuer to repenteAlas your
                    vnkyndenesse þus haith my herte schente
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.
